description: Warehouse is very easy to use. Sometime ago, Ungoogled Chromium reached the EOL cycle and a new one took it's place, but I could not delete the old one out of my system using Discover. It showed up under my updates everytime I got onto the computer and just wouldn't update. I finally found Warehouse and a few seconds later was able to make it vanish. Highly recomend to anyone that's not so good with the command line.

I'm doing a (free) management tool (just a hobby, won't be big and professional like flatseal) for flatpak. This has been brewing since may, and is starting to get ready. I'd like any feedback on things people like/dislike in the tool. I've currently created a GUI, and things seem to work. This implies that I'll get something practical within a few months, and I'd like to know what features most people would want. Any suggestions are welcome, but I won't promise I'll implement them :-)
THE best Flatpak manager out there. Has never disappointed me, I have always found what I needed. Just simple and functional!
this app made me ware all over my house 10/10
A perfect app to manage your flatpaks with a lot of utilities, really helpful to have more control!
summary: Really good and easy to learn

description:
Many thanks to the developer.
Does what is supposed to do that is manage Flatpak apps, but does not run them.
Can take a while to download via Gnome store/snap iterface.
Fri-Oct-20-2023
thank you it is an amazing app
Can Acquire arbitrary permissions; Can access some specific files.

With combination of Flatseal, it's wonderful to manage your flatpaks. "Manage leftover data" made it easy to move to new system since it can reinstall all your apps based on your .var/app folder you backed up from your system. Incredibly useful
